DOC.brief_summary: The H4K Trial randomize control trial improve child 's body composition test comprehensive , culturally linguistically relevant , family-oriented intervention overweight obese Hispanic child ( age 6-11 ) three pediatric clinic San Antonio , Texas . The H4K trial test efficacy 6-month pediatric obesity management intervention ( physician counseling plus telephone counseling , newsletter text message ) compare standard care ( physician counseling ) three outcome : 1 ) body composition ( i.e. , waist circumference , weight z-BMI ) ; 2 ) insulin , glucose cholesterol level ; 3 ) behavior change physical activity ( PA ) , sedentary behavior consumption sugary beverage fruit vegetable . The investigator recruit 230 overweight obese children—and parent guardian each—and randomize H4K intervention ( n = 115 child/parent dyad ) standard care ( n = 115 child/parent dyad ) . The investigator hypothesize intervention child significantly improve body composition , increase PA level diet quality ( fruits vegetable less sugary beverage ) , decrease sedentary activity , compare child standard care . If successful , study generate new scientific knowledge effective Hispanic family-based approach obesity prevention high potential replication underserved area across nation .
DOC.detailed_description: Given continue rise U.S. Hispanic population , reverse Hispanic childhood obesity epidemic critical nation 's future health . Mexican American child socioeconomically disadvantaged family often far overweight obese peer , heighten risk obesity-related health complication . Our propose randomize control trial , Health4Kids ( H4K ) Trial Hispanic Families , aim improve Hispanic child 's body composition test comprehensive , culturally linguistically relevant , family-oriented intervention overweight obese ( body mass index ( BMI ) 85th 99.9thth ( < 99th ) percentile age gender ) Hispanic child age 6-11 pediatric clinic San Antonio , Texas , largely Hispanic city . Our team , form pilot research fund Centers Medicare Medicaid Services ( 1H0CMS030457 ) , unites academic investigator community partner experience work together conduct behavioral clinical intervention outreach Hispanics . The H4K trial test efficacy 6-month pediatric obesity management intervention ( physician counseling plus telephone counseling , newsletter text message ) compare standard care ( physician counseling ) three outcome : 1 ) body composition ( i.e. , waist circumference , weight z-BMI ) ; 2 ) insulin , glucose cholesterol level ; 3 ) behavior change physical activity ( PA ) , sedentary behavior consumption sugary beverage fruit vegetable . We recruit 230 overweight obese children—and parent guardian each—and randomize POM intervention ( n = 115 child/parent dyad ) standard care ( n = 115 child/parent dyad ) . From baseline , measure impact trial primary outcome ( body composition ) secondary outcome ( insulin , glucose cholesterol level several specific health behavior change ) 1 month , 6 12 month post-randomization . We also evaluate critical role parent strategy change home environment mediator intervention effect . We hypothesize intervention child significantly improve body composition , increase PA level diet quality ( fruits vegetable less sugary beverage ) , decrease sedentary activity , compare child standard care . If successful , study generate new scientific knowledge effective Hispanic family-based approach obesity prevention high potential replication underserved area across nation .
